urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text:
I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency The Environment agency are pretty toothless. A small fine, no restorative powers. Its horrific. Landowners know that under this current government nothing will be done. @MPGeorgeEustice what will you do?

tweets.text: Horrified to find this ditch scalped yet again. The growth over the top of it was purely brambles , bits of hogweed  and more brambles. Giving shade shelter and food to countless birds and small mammals. The farmer responsible for this In Rendham Suffolk does this regularly..üò°üò¢ https://t.co/sXx2NVLmHI
@paulrhodes180 @AndyWoodturner @RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Yes, the response needs to be more than a fine for exactly this reason.

When certain things happen, it's easy (and fair) to be angry with @EnvAgency but even @Feargal_Sharkey will agree coal-face EA staff, especially in Fisheries & Biodiversity teams are hard working, passionate people doing hard jobs. It's the backbone of the top brass that fail us

Please reply with the hashtag #BBCWildlifexEcover & retweet to help us win ¬£150,000 from @Ecoveruk's #FertiliseTheFuture fund! Our @SalmonStour project will improve the River Stour for people & wildlife such as kingfisher & otter! Read more: https://t.co/gSHnuItC1k
#LetsLiveClean https://t.co/93QVzRVRvt

Counting #salmon redds in Swindale Beck today with @EnvAgencyNW. Really decent numbers, with at least 43 redds seen in the 1km stretch at the bottom of the valley, and plenty further up too. Saw loads of big fish, dead & alive. #rivers https://t.co/CJviM1ZN7n

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @bilgribs I instigated a meeting between Hackney Council and the EA to talk about the river Lea. The EA officer explained that they now have to rely on polluters like Thames Water to report themselves. Imagine how well that‚Äôs going.
